title: Showdown in the Data Core
narrative_instruction: Narrate in third person limited, past tense, from Red's perspective. Characters (Red, Wolf-9, Grandmother) must be introduced as if meeting the reader for the first time; avoid any assumed prior knowledge or familiarity. Clearly establish Red's motivations, Wolf-9's ambiguous allegiance, and Grandmother's expertise. Do not reference prior events; allow character relationships to emerge naturally.
transition_hint: Open with a high-stakes infiltration scene, framing the action as the immediate situation. After climax, use Red’s emotional response (confusion, urgency) as a bridge to a reflective moment.

title: Escape Through the Dust Storm
narrative_instruction: Maintain third person limited, past tense, from Red's perspective. Use interpolation within Red’s flashback/thoughts to show her escape through the dust storm, discovery of the tracker, and Wolf-9’s pursuit. Ensure character relationships are consistent with the earlier chapter—Red, Wolf-9, and Grandmother are still being established.
transition_hint: Transition from previous chapter’s flashback trigger (Red’s memory of entering the core) into a recollection of her hazardous journey, using sensory cues (dust, damage) to anchor the narrative.

title: Red Receives a Secret Mission
narrative_instruction: Continue in third person limited, past tense, primarily from Red’s perspective. Present the mission briefing at the rebel hideout as a further flashback, deepening Red’s motivations and introducing Dr. Hood. Use this chapter to fill in the background for Red and establish her connection to her grandmother and Wolf-9.
transition_hint: Use Red’s recollection of her creator’s instructions as the natural segue from the dust storm escape to the mission’s origin.

title: Wolf-9 Infiltrates the Hacker's Lair
narrative_instruction: Maintain third person limited, past tense, from Red’s perspective with occasional external observations. Portray Wolf-9’s infiltration and Grandmother’s defensive strategies. Ensure the sequence flows logically from Red’s recollections, and the character relationships remain consistent with their first encounters.
transition_hint: Shift from Red’s flashback to current events by describing Wolf-9’s actions as seen through surveillance, or as relayed to Red via encrypted messages.

title: Checkpoint Ambush
narrative_instruction: Continue third person limited, past tense, focusing on Red’s perception of Wolf-9 at the security checkpoint. Carefully reconstruct the character relationship—Red and Wolf-9 should be wary but not yet adversaries, reflecting the timeline shift.
transition_hint: Segue from Wolf-9’s surveillance efforts to Red’s checkpoint encounter, using Grandmother’s warning or Red’s own caution as connective tissue.

title: Red Breaks Into the Lair
narrative_instruction: Maintain third person limited, past tense, from Red’s point of view. Show Red’s infiltration of the lair and her alliance with Grandmother against Wolf-9. Ensure the narrative builds on the established tension and shifting loyalties.
transition_hint: Transition from the flashback into present action by ending Red’s recollection and returning to the immediate confrontation at the lair perimeter.

title: Upload or Destroy
narrative_instruction: Continue in third person limited, past tense, from Red’s perspective. Depict the debate over the data drive and Wolf-9’s attempt to bargain. Carefully handle the trust issues among the trio, reflecting their evolving relationships.
transition_hint: Use the emotional fallout and tension from the previous confrontation to lead directly into the debate and moral decision.

title: Aftermath and New Beginnings
narrative_instruction: Maintain third person limited, past tense, from Red’s perspective. Depict the aftermath, focusing on Red’s growth, Grandmother’s pride, and Wolf-9’s uncertain future. Ensure all character relationships reflect the events and emotional journeys of previous chapters.
transition_hint: Transition from the planetary blackout’s aftermath to scenes of rebuilding and reconciliation, using physical and emotional recovery as a narrative bridge.
